cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fairytales captivate and engage global audiences around the world.
Fairytales convey moral lessons within their narratives.
remarks: Relation name chosen to emphasize didactic function rather than mere inclusion.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Fairytales are said to provide valuable insights into the human experience.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Narrative works that capture and hold the attention of audiences.
args.justification: This relation links fairytales to the audiences whose attention they capture; the core predicate is audience engagement.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Narrative works that communicate or teach moral lessons through their content.
args.justification: Both relations describe stories functioning to communicate moral lessons, differing only in phrasing and subject granularity (fairytales vs timeless stories).

args.canonical_rel_desc: Narrative works that offer conceptual or emotional understanding of an aspect of human life or experience.
args.justification: This relation specifically captures the epistemic function where fairytales offer insight into the human experience.

All four relations connect narrative forms (fairytales, timeless stories) to their effects or functions on audiences or understanding (engagement, moral instruction, insight). Grouping them under a common narrative-effect class reflects this shared semantics.
Each relation describes an outcome or impact produced by stories (engaging audiences, conveying morals, providing insight), which aligns with an EFFECT-oriented semantic group.

All four relations connect narrative forms (fairytales, timeless stories) to their effects or functions on audiences or understanding (engagement, moral instruction, insight). Grouping them under a common narrative-effect class reflects this shared semantics.
